publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-557# Patricia Ferguson: International Women's Day—That the Parliament notes that 8 March is celebrated as International Women’s Day, recognises the important contribution made by women to all aspects of Scottish life and, in doing so, acknowledges the progress made towards women’s equality and the need to ensure that the programme of government responds to the aspirations of women. Supported by: Malcolm Chisholm*, Ms Margaret Curran*, Johann Lamont*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Cathy Jamieson*

S1M-557# Patricia Ferguson: International Women's Day—That the Parliament notes that 8 March is celebrated as International Women’s Day, recognises the important contribution made by women to all aspects of Scottish life and, in doing so, acknowledges the progress made towards women’s equality and the need to ensure that any programme of government responds to the aspirations of women. Supported by: Malcolm Chisholm, Ms Margaret Curran, Johann Lamont, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Cathy Jamieson, Margaret Jamieson*, Elaine Thomson*
S1M-557# International Women's Day (lodged on 17 February 2000) Mrs Mary Mulligan*
S1M-557# International Women's Day (lodged on 17 February 2000) Tommy Sheridan*, Scott Barrie*
S1M-557# International Women's Day (lodged on 17 February 2000) Elaine Smith*, Fiona Hyslop*

S1M-557# Patricia Ferguson: International Women's Day—That the Parliament notes that 8 March is celebrated as International Women’s Day, recognises the important contribution made by women to all aspects of Scottish life and, in doing so, acknowledges the progress made towards women’s equality and the need to ensure that any programme of government responds to the aspirations of women. Supported by: Malcolm Chisholm, Ms Margaret Curran, Johann Lamont, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Cathy Jamieson, Margaret Jamieson, Elaine Thomson, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Tommy Sheridan, Scott Barrie, Elaine Smith, Fiona Hyslop, Hugh Henry*, Nora Radcliffe*, Trish Godman*
S1M-557# International Women's Day (lodged on 17 February 2000) Christine Grahame*, Rhoda Grant*, Pauline McNeill*
S1M-557# International Women's Day (lodged on 17 February 2000) Alex Neil*, Michael Russell*, Fiona McLeod*, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-557# International Women's Day (lodged on 17 February 2000) Dr Elaine Murray*, Mike Watson*, Ms Sandra White*, Linda Fabiani*
S1M-557# International Women's Day (lodged on 17 February 2000) Richard Lochhead*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*

S1M-557# Patricia Ferguson: International Women's Day—That the Parliament notes that 8 March is celebrated as International Women’s Day, recognises the important contribution made by women to all aspects of Scottish life and, in doing so, acknowledges the progress made towards women’s equality and the need to ensure that any programme of government responds to the aspirations of women. Supported by: Malcolm Chisholm, Ms Margaret Curran, Johann Lamont, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Cathy Jamieson, Margaret Jamieson, Elaine Thomson, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Tommy Sheridan, Scott Barrie, Elaine Smith, Fiona Hyslop, Hugh Henry, Nora Radcliffe, Trish Godman, Christine Grahame, Rhoda Grant, Pauline McNeill, Alex Neil, Michael Russell, Fiona McLeod, Donald Gorrie, Dr Elaine Murray, Mike Watson, Ms Sandra White, Linda Fabiani, Richard Lochhead, Mrs Margaret Ewing
S1M-557# International Women's Day (lodged on 17 February 2000) Maureen Macmillan*
